channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump administration ends temporary protected status for thousands of Afghans
item.description: As soon as May 20, thousands of Afghans living in the U.S. will lose a protection that shielded them from deportation and allowed them to work.
item.content:encoded:
As soon as May 20, thousands of Afghans living in the U.S. will lose a protection that shielded them from deportation and allowed them to work.

(Image credit: Joseph Prezioso)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Trump says he took a cognitive test as part of his latest physical
item.description: President Trump had his first physical of his second term on Friday at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump had his first physical of his second term on Friday at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Dozens of USAID contracts were canceled last weekend. Here's what happened
item.description: The rationale was to address "mismanagement, fraud, and misaligned priorities." Former USAID official Jeremy Konyndyk said reversals and inconsistences in the cancellations created "total whiplash."
item.content:encoded:
The rationale was to address "mismanagement, fraud, and misaligned priorities." Former USAID official Jeremy Konyndyk said reversals and inconsistences in the cancellations created "total whiplash."

(Image credit: Wakil Kohsar/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Melody Schreiber

item.title: How Trump's immigration policy changes who gets arrested and detained
item.description:
During his second Presidential campaign, Donald Trump vowed to carry out the largest deportation program the U.S. has ever seen.

And true to his word – Trump's administration is arresting, detaining and deporting immigrants without legal status.

But as part of the crackdown on illegal immigration, legal immigrants are getting caught up in the mix.

And then there's people like Amir Makled – a U.S. Citizen and lawyer. Makled was detained by Border agents at a Detroit airport as he returned from a family vacation in the Caribbean.

How is the Trump administration's immigration policy changing who is getting arrested and detained?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
During his second Presidential campaign, Donald Trump vowed to carry out the largest deportation program the U.S. has ever seen.

And true to his word – Trump's administration is arresting, detaining and deporting immigrants without legal status.

But as part of the crackdown on illegal immigration, legal immigrants are getting caught up in the mix.

And then there's people like Amir Makled – a U.S. Citizen and lawyer. Makled was detained by Border agents at a Detroit airport as he returned from a family vacation in the Caribbean.

How is the Trump administration's immigration policy changing who is getting arrested and detained?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

item.title: 'I cannot guarantee complete confidentiality,' VA therapists ordered to tell veterans
item.description: Mental health therapists at Veterans Affairs should begin sessions with patients saying they are in a shared office space, a memo obtained by NPR says. Trump's back-to-office orders start Monday for VA.
item.content:encoded:
Mental health therapists at Veterans Affairs should begin sessions with patients saying they are in a shared office space, a memo obtained by NPR says. Trump's back-to-office orders start Monday for VA.

(Image credit: Jeremy Hogan/SOPA Images)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Major budget cuts proposed for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration
item.description: The agency forecasts weather, manages fisheries, and researches the world's oceans, atmosphere, and climate. The proposed budget cuts would slash the climate work entirely.
item.content:encoded:
The agency forecasts weather, manages fisheries, and researches the world's oceans, atmosphere, and climate. The proposed budget cuts would slash the climate work entirely.

(Image credit: Handout/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: Judge rules Mahmoud Khalil can be deported
item.description: The judge gave Khalil until April 23 to request a stay of his deportation and said that if his attorneys miss the deadline, she will order him deported either to Syria or to Algeria
item.content:encoded:
The judge gave Khalil until April 23 to request a stay of his deportation and said that if his attorneys miss the deadline, she will order him deported either to Syria or to Algeria

(Image credit: Ted Shaffrey)
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: Allegations of a Land Grab on Nigeria's Coast
item.description: Many communities have thrived for years on the peninsula and islands in the lagoon around Nigeria's crowded commercial capital Lagos. But the last decade has seen a violent shift, as thousands of people have been evicted by the Nigerian Navy and the government in an apparent effort to make way for luxury developments. We go to the communities and meet the people affected.
item.content:encoded: Many communities have thrived for years on the peninsula and islands in the lagoon around Nigeria's crowded commercial capital Lagos. But the last decade has seen a violent shift, as thousands of people have been evicted by the Nigerian Navy and the government in an apparent effort to make way for luxury developments. We go to the communities and meet the people affected.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Are Trump's tariffs a bargaining chip for a new global economic order?
item.description: It's not just tariffs. The White House is rethinking the central role of the dollar in the global economy.
item.content:encoded:
It's not just tariffs. The White House is rethinking the central role of the dollar in the global economy.

(Image credit: BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Maryland judge again asks government to return man wrongly deported to El Salvador
item.description: A federal judge in Maryland wants the government to "facilitate" Abrego Garcia's return to the U.S. after the Supreme Court largely upheld her original order.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge in Maryland wants the government to "facilitate" Abrego Garcia's return to the U.S. after the Supreme Court largely upheld her original order.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose
